title: Is the U.S. Really Less Corrupt Than China — and How About Russia? (Ep. 481 Update)
description: The political scientist Yuen Yuen Ang argues that different forms of government create different styles of corruption. The U.S. and China have more in common than we’d like to admit — but Russia is a different story, which could explain its willingness to invade Ukraine.
author: editor@freakonomics.com (Freakonomics Radio + Stitcher)
content:encoded: The political scientist Yuen Yuen Ang argues that different forms of government create different styles of corruption. The U.S. and China have more in common than we’d like to admit — but Russia is a different story, which could explain its willingness to invade Ukraine.
